cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast toward the northeastern Gulf Coast, forecast to cross the Florida Big Bend Thursday night and then sweep northeastward across GA/SC and along the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect from Marineland FL northward to South Santee River SC (north of Port Canaveral)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL (Gulf side – well west of Port Canaveral)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast Big Bend (life-threatening surge), then GA–NC Atlantic coasts; only fringe impacts anticipated along Florida’s east-central coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (most guidance 1–3 inches, locally 4 inches possible)
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible Friday as outer bands pass (sustained winds generally 25–35 mph, gusts 40 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation around 1–2 ft near high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 1–3 in, isolated 4 in, Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in outer rain-bands on Fri
